answers.answer: Thank you very much for your question; although it is quite hard for me to give you a precise opinion here without being able to examine you, but I would try to provide you some relevant information about your health concern. From your description of symptoms, it appears that you have the feeling of physical tiredness (fatigue) that is related to a cause such as excessive effort in the sports activity. It could be possible that you had similar physical strength earlier, but presently it is essential to evaluate the possibilities of underlying diseases such as anemia, diabetes, nutritional deficiency, infections since they can decline the normal physical efforts. In addition it is also essential to evaluate that if you are suffering from any other symptoms such as night sweats, weight change, breathing difficulties and excessive thirst. Essentially, you need to insure that you lead a healthy life. This means a good diet, exercise (limited not excessive) and plenty of sleep. If you suffer continuous weakness and notice reduced strength of muscle bulk in hands and legs, please arrange an appointment with a doctor right away. Hope this helps. Take Care & Stay Healthy!!!

Thanks for your reply. Well after googling about symptoms of anemia and diabetes i am sure of not having those. About nutritional deficiency and infection i don't know how 2 know about that. And i don't feel reduced muscle strength on both legs and hands.. Its just that i start too feel weaker after climbing few steps. Since i am overweight i would come to know if my legs are not supporting and same goes to hands. Also i don't have night sweats, no weight change, no breathing difficulties and no excessive thirst. Hope i am not suffering from anything serious. Also i would like to know.. If i am tired i.e physically tired.. Then how much time does it require to recover. Also the climate over here is cool.

It sounds that you have temporary fatigue due to your excessive physical efforts in sports activity. It will  be best that you don't over-exert for the period of time since body has own limitations in strength. Additionally, keep your nutrition high by taking minerals & protein rich diet and take sufficient sleep. If this doesn't resolve your health concern then consult a doctor for further assessment and advice. Hope this helps.

Though the degree of bending on left hand is more than right hand. Also i feel weak when pulling stuffs near me through finger and picking up items. This problem started with the pain and weakness on legs. Though my condition on legs has improved a lot.. the weakness on fingers has improved very very less. Can this be also caused due to fatigue? Well its been a weak now.. So should i wait more or do i need to go to a doctor? And if i wait do you think it will get better? Thanks in advance.
I would be happy if anyone reply's to my last query. I just dont wanna go to the doctor :(.

Thank you for your question. Yes, if the fatigue is severe and if there is any electrolytic (minerals) imbalance, you may experience generalized body weakness. In addition, as your sport activity is badminton that requires a quite tight grip of hands for long hours so that may be the leading cause of your pain in fingers/hand. As your leg symptoms are improving, I recommend you to please avoid over-exertion in your game for a period of time till your other fatigue symptoms subsides. Take Care & Regards.
